001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers;
002
003import java.math.BigInteger;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.Comparator;
006
007public final class RationalBigIntegerSupport implements JavaNumberTypeSupport<Rational<BigInteger>> {
008
009    private static final Rational<BigInteger> ONE = new Rational<>(BigInteger.ONE, BigInteger.ONE);
010    private static final Rational<BigInteger> MINUS_ONE = new Rational<>(BigInteger.valueOf(-1), BigInteger.ONE);
011    private static final Rational<BigInteger> ZERO = new Rational<>(BigInteger.ZERO, BigInteger.ONE);
012    private static final Rational<BigInteger> EPSILON = new Rational<>(BigInteger.ONE, BigInteger.valueOf(1_000_000_000));
013
014    protected RationalBigIntegerSupport() {
015    }
016
017    @Override
018    public String name() {
019        return "Rational with BigInteger";
020    }
021
022    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
023    @Override
024    public Rational<BigInteger>[] createArray(int length) {
025        Rational<BigInteger>[] array = (Rational<BigInteger>[]) new Rational<?>[length];
026        Arrays.fill(array, ZERO);
027        return array;
028    }
029
030    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
031    @Override
032    public Rational<BigInteger>[][] createArrayOfArrays(int rows, int columns) {
033        Rational<BigInteger>[][] rationals = (Rational<BigInteger>[][]) new Rational<?>[rows][columns];
034        for (Rational<BigInteger>[] array : rationals) {
035            Arrays.fill(array, ZERO);
036        }
037        return rationals;
038    }
039
040    @Override
041    public Rational<BigInteger> multiply(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
042        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.numerator()),
043                first.denominator().multiply(second.denominator()));
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    public Rational<BigInteger> multiply(Rational<BigInteger> first, int second) {
048        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(BigInteger.valueOf(second)), first.denominator());
049    }
050
051    @Override
052    public Rational<BigInteger> divide(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
053        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()),
054                first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator()));
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    public Rational<BigInteger> divide(Rational<BigInteger> first, int second) {
059        return rational(first.numerator(), first.denominator().multiply(BigInteger.valueOf(second)));
060    }
061
062    @Override
063    public Rational<BigInteger> add(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
064        if (first.denominator().equals(second.denominator())) {
065            return rational(first.numerator().add(second.numerator()), first.denominator());
066        }
067        if (first.denominator().mod(second.denominator()).equals(BigInteger.ZERO)) {
068            BigInteger factor = first.denominator().divide(second.denominator());
069            return rational(first.numerator().add(second.numerator().multiply(factor)), first.denominator());
070        }
071        if (second.denominator().mod(first.denominator()).equals(BigInteger.ZERO)) {
072            BigInteger factor = second.denominator().divide(first.denominator());
073            return rational(first.numerator().multiply(factor).add(second.numerator()), second.denominator());
074        }
075        return rational(first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).add(second.numerator().multiply(first.denominator())), first.denominator().multiply(second.denominator()));
076    }
077
078    @Override
079    public Rational<BigInteger> add(Rational<BigInteger> first, int second) {
080        return rational(first.numerator().add(first.denominator().multiply(BigInteger.valueOf(second))), first.denominator());
081    }
082
083    private Rational<BigInteger> rational(BigInteger numerator, BigInteger denominator) {
084        if (numerator.equals(denominator)) {
085            return ONE;
086        }
087        BigInteger gcd = gcd(numerator, denominator);
088        if (gcd.compareTo(BigInteger.ONE) > 0) {
089            numerator = numerator.divide(gcd);
090            denominator = denominator.divide(gcd);
091        }
092        return new Rational<>(numerator, denominator);
093    }
094
095    private static BigInteger gcd(BigInteger a, BigInteger b) {
096        a = a.abs();
097        b = b.abs();
098        while (b.compareTo(BigInteger.ZERO) != 0) {
099            BigInteger temp = b;
100            b = a.mod(b);
101            a = temp;
102        }
103        return a;
104    }
105
106    @Override
107    public Rational<BigInteger> minusOne() {
108        return MINUS_ONE;
109    }
110
111    @Override
112    public Rational<BigInteger> one() {
113        return ONE;
114    }
115
116    @Override
117    public Rational<BigInteger> zero() {
118        return ZERO;
119    }
120
121    @Override
122    public boolean equals(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
123        return first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).compareTo(first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator())) == 0;
124    }
125
126    @Override
127    public boolean isGreaterThan(Rational<BigInteger> first, Rational<BigInteger> second) {
128        return first.numerator().multiply(second.denominator()).compareTo(first.denominator().multiply(second.numerator())) > 0;
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    public Rational<BigInteger> squareRoot(Rational<BigInteger> value) {
133        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
134    }
135
136    @Override
137    public Rational<BigInteger> valueOf(double value) {
138        if (!Double.isFinite(value)) {
139            throw new IllegalArgumentException("NaN/Infinity not supported");
140        }
141        if (value == 0.0) return ZERO;
142        value = Math.round(value * 1000) / 1000.0;
143        String s = Double.toString(value);
144
145        // Handle scientific notation by converting to plain string
146        if (s.contains("E") || s.contains("e")) {
147            s = new java.math.BigDecimal(s).toPlainString();
148        }
149
150        int pos = s.indexOf('.');
151        int numerator;
152        int denominator;
153
154        if (pos == -1) {
155            // No decimal point
156            numerator = Integer.parseInt(s);
157            denominator = 1;
158        } else {
159            int digitsAfter = s.length() - pos - 1;
160            String digits = s.substring(0, pos) + s.substring(pos + 1);
161
162            numerator = Integer.parseInt(digits);
163            denominator = (int) Math.pow(10, digitsAfter);
164        }
165
166        return numerator == denominator ? ONE : rational(BigInteger.valueOf(numerator), BigInteger.valueOf(denominator));
167    }
168
169    @Override
170    public Comparator<Rational<BigInteger>> comparator() {
171        return (o1, o2) -> isGreaterThan(o1, o2) ? 1 : isGreaterThan(o2, o1) ? -1 : 0;
172    }
173
174    @Override
175    public Rational<BigInteger> clamp01(Rational<BigInteger> value) {
176        if (value.numerator().compareTo(BigInteger.ZERO) <= 0) {
177            return ZERO;
178        }
179        if (value.numerator().compareTo(value.denominator()) >= 0) {
180            return ONE;
181        }
182        return value;
183    }
184
185    @Override
186    public Rational<BigInteger> epsilon() {
187        return EPSILON;
188    }
189
190    @Override
191    public Rational<BigInteger> log(Rational<BigInteger> value) {
192        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
193    }
194
195    @Override
196    public boolean isInstance(Object value) {
197        return value instanceof Rational<?> r && r.numerator() instanceof BigInteger && r.denominator() instanceof BigInteger;
198    }
199}
